Event: The individual is experiencing depressed thoughts and feelings of worthlessness, which are affecting their relationships and daily life. They are also struggling with self-loathing and the fear of being too obsessive or desperate in their interactions with others. The event is having a negative impact on the individual's mental health and causing them to feel purposeless and hopeless.
Post:
"I can't seem to shake off this feeling of worthlessness, no matter how hard I try. I feel like I'm a burden to my loved ones and that I'll never be good enough. My relationships are suffering because of it, and I'm constantly plagued by thoughts of self-loathing. I'm afraid of being too clingy or desperate in my interactions with others, but at the same time, I feel like I have no purpose in life. It's a constant struggle that's taking a toll on my mental health."

This post attributes the individual's struggles with depression and feelings of worthlessness to their own inherent flaws or shortcomings, rather than to external circumstances or temporary situations. By using phrases such as "I'm just naturally bad at it" or "I'm just an inherently disorganized person," the post reinforces a negative self-image and perpetuates a stable attributional style.

Event: My dad killed himself several years ago because my mom left him for some douchebag with money. My dog followed three months later. I got an incurable STD from someone I trusted but shouldn't have. I've lost my license, and my car. I'm trapped in a dead-end janitorial job that I've been maxed out in for the last 3 years. My spare income goes towards weed, so I can keep myself blithe and functional. Everything is falling or has fallen apart. I'll always be poor. I'll always be lonely, I'll always be depressed. The woman I've been talking to is married, and on top of it, I think is close to dumping me for another side guy. I could be imagining that. Things have been different for several weeks. Then since we've gotten closer to the New Year, she distanced herself more and more. I think she's trying to get me to break up with her so she can move on guilt-free. I don't know. We barely communicate. It seems like she has better things to do.
Post: "I'm always lonely, depressed, and poor because I'm just not cut out for life. My mom leaving my dad for someone else and my dog dying shortly afterward really messed me up. I've been stuck in a dead-end job for years and have lost everything else that mattered to me. I'll never be able to escape this cycle of misery."

Event:
The individual experienced depression and suicidal thoughts, which were alleviated by their girlfriend's support.

Conversion to a more fluent and general expression: The individual had been dealing with depression for a long time, which they initially thought was due to loneliness. However, after being in a relationship with their current girlfriend, they realized that the root cause of their depression was not just loneliness, but rather a deeper issue. Despite having a good life and an amazing partner, the individual still struggled with depression and suicidal thoughts.
Post: "I've been battling depression for what feels like an eternity, and I thought it was just because I was lonely. But even after finding an amazing partner, the darkness still lingers. It's like there's this voice in my head that won't shut up, telling me I'm not good enough, that I don't deserve to be happy. It's a constant struggle to stay afloat, to keep my head above water. But I'm trying, every day, to find the strength to keep going." #SAS #depression #mentalhealth
